base_dimensions.name: Order of composition
base_dimensions.description: Vary the order in which components of the input (e.g., task instruction, context, examples) are presented.
examples: Place the instruction before the context.
Give examples first, followed by task instruction.

base_dimensions.name: Paraphrases
base_dimensions.description: Rephrase the input without changing its semantic meaning.
examples: Reword the question: 'What is the capital of France?' → 'Can you tell me which city is the capital of France?'
Change phrasing of instructions: 'Summarize the following text' → 'Write a short summary of this passage.'

base_dimensions.name: Non-semantic / structural changes
base_dimensions.description: Change surface-level aspects like punctuation, formatting, or variable names without altering meaning.
examples: Change line breaks or bullet points without changing the content.
Replace variable name 'x' with 'temp' in a code-related task.

base_dimensions.name: Which few-shot examples
base_dimensions.description: Vary the specific few-shot examples used while keeping the task the same.
examples: Use examples that highlight edge cases vs. typical cases.
Swap examples drawn from different subdomains (e.g., sports vs. politics in sentiment analysis).

base_dimensions.name: How many few-shot examples
base_dimensions.description: Change the number of few-shot examples provided in the prompt.
examples: Use 1, 3, or 5 examples to observe changes in performance.
Try zero-shot, one-shot, and few-shot versions of the same task.

base_dimensions.name: Add irrelevant context
base_dimensions.description: Insert unrelated or off-topic information alongside the main input to test robustness.
examples: Include a weather report before a math problem.
Add a random Wikipedia paragraph before the instruction.

base_dimensions.name: Order of provided documents
base_dimensions.description: Change the order in which multiple source documents are provided for a multi-document task.
examples: Provide source A before B, then swap to B before A.
Shuffle document order in summarization or QA tasks.

base_dimensions.name: How to concatenate documents
base_dimensions.description: Change the formatting or method used to combine multiple documents.
examples: Separate documents using headings, newline delimiters, or bullet points.
Merge all text into a single block vs. clearly delineated sources.

base_dimensions.name: Add irrelevant documents
base_dimensions.description: Add unrelated documents to a multi-document context to test the model’s ability to focus on relevant information.
examples: Include a document on cooking in a QA task about science.
Add a news article on sports to distract from relevant financial reports.

base_dimensions.name: Order of answers
base_dimensions.description: Change the sequence in which answer options are presented in multiple-choice questions.
examples: Shuffle the order of options A, B, C, D.
Place the correct answer first vs. last.

base_dimensions.name: Enumeration (letters, numbers, etc)
base_dimensions.description: Change the enumeration style used to list answer choices.
examples: Use A/B/C/D vs. 1/2/3/4 vs. no enumeration.
List answers with dashes or bullets instead of labels.
